customer_addr:
14990 PALM BEACH POINT BLVD
WEST PALM BEACH, FL 33414

citations.narrative:
Within the primary enclosure housing six black-and-white ruffed lemurs, electrical cords for the fans were hanging inside
the enclosure. Within the primary enclosure housing two red-ruffed lemurs, electrical cords for the fans were hanging
inside the enclosure. The cords were plugged in at time of inspection. There were also heating lamps affixed to the inside
of the enclosures without protective coverings. Portions of the electrical cords and heating lamps were within reach of the
animals. Unprotected powered electrical cords and heating lamps that are within an animal’s reach allows access to an
electrical hazard that can cause electrocution, injury, and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and
maintained so that they protect the non-human primates from injury. To be corrected by April 28, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, there was no documented environmental enhancement program for the nine non-human
primates housed at the facility. An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the
psychological well-being of non-human primates. Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and
follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-human
primates, it must be in accordance with the currently accepted professional standards and as directed by the attending
veterinarian. The licensee must ensure that a documented plan for environmental enrichment that addresses the required
elements is maintained and available for inspection. To be corrected by May 3, 2023.

The electrical cords for the fans are inside the enclosures for two sloths and two tamanduas. The cords were plugged in
at time of the inspection. The cords pose a danger to the animals if they bite into it or become tangled in the cord.
Electrical cords must be inaccessible to the animals to prevent electrocution or other injuries. To be corrected by April
28,2023.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee and manager.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(2)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Within the primary enclosure housing six black-and-white ruffed lemurs, electrical cords for the fans were hanging inside 
the enclosure. Within the primary enclosure housing two red-ruffed lemurs, electrical cords for the fans were hanging 
inside the enclosure. The cords were plugged in at time of inspection. There were also heating lamps affixed to the inside 
of the enclosures without protective coverings. Portions of the electrical cords and heating lamps were within reach of the 
animals. Unprotected powered electrical cords and heating lamps that are within an animal’s reach allows access to an 
electrical hazard that can cause electrocution, injury, and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and 
maintained so that they protect the non-human primates from injury. To be corrected by April 28, 2023. 
3.81 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection, there was no documented environmental enhancement program for the nine non-human 
primates housed at the facility. An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the 
psychological well-being of non-human primates. Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and 
follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-human 
primates, it must be in accordance with the currently accepted professional standards and as directed by the attending

veterinarian. The licensee must ensure that a documented plan for environmental enrichment that addresses the required 
elements is maintained and available for inspection. To be corrected by May 3, 2023. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The electrical cords for the fans are inside the enclosures for two sloths and two tamanduas. The cords were plugged in 
at time of the inspection. The cords pose a danger to the animals if they bite into it or become tangled in the cord. 
Electrical cords must be inaccessible to the animals to prevent electrocution or other injuries. To be corrected by April 
28,2023. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee and manager.
